QuNet

MetaGraphs.MetaDiGraph — Method

Convert a QNetwork object to a directed MetaGraphs in Julia LightGraphs. Directed MetaGraphs are used over weighted di-graphs is because they are more performant at removing edges.

source
QuNet.BasicChannel — Type

Default Channel type

source
QuNet.BasicNetwork — Type

Basic QNetwork structure. Although it is mutable, removing nodes and channels should be avoided. Large manipulations are done by parsing QuNet into more optimised graph structures via convertNet!()

source
QuNet.BasicNode — Type

The default QNode object. Nothing special, but nothing unspecial either ;-)"

QuNet.FibreChannel — Type

Fibre optic channel, where the cost is determined by exponential loss in length

source
QuNet.Pathset — Type

Pathset is a collection of paths that all start at some vertex u and end at some vertex v. The purpose of the pathset is to organise / keep track of paths that are purified together.

source
QuNet.PurifiedChannel — Type

Channel class for multiple channels purified together

QuNet.addNode! — Method

Add one or more nodes to the network.

If the node being initialised already exists in the network, (the IDs are equal) addNode replaces it. If node ID is greater than the number of nodes in the network, function warns user and sets node ID to nv + 1

source
QuNet.addPurifyChannel — Method

After purification, this function adds a channel between the src and dst with the purified costs and information about the Pathset.

source
QuNet.add_async_nodes! — Method

Add asynchronus nodes to a Temporal Network.

This function adds tempnet.nv nodes to the graph. If a given node is source, outgoing asynchronus edges are added to the node that connects it to its temporal counterparts. This is done with incremental timeweights ϵ so that earlier times are prioritized.

Likewise if a node is a dest, incoming asynchronus edges are added with incremental weights ϵ.

source

Calculate costs for AirChannel given length

source
QuNet.ave_paths_used — Method

Given a tally for the number of paths used by each end-user in a greedy_protocol: (i.e. [3,4,2,1] meaning 3 end-users used no paths, 4, end-users used 1 path, etc.) This function finds the average number of paths used in the protocol.

QuNet.dict_average — Method

Return average average value for an array of cost vectors. If the length of the input is less than 1, mean is not well defined, the key values returned are 'nothing'.

source
QuNet.dict_err — Method

Return average standard error for an array of cost vectors. If the length of the input is less than 2, error is not well defined, the key values returned are 'nothing'.

QuNet.fix_async_nodes_in_time! — Method

For a given node at time T in a TemporalGraph, this function fixes its asynchronus counterpart with respect to T This is done by removing all edges of the asynchronus node except for the one connecting at time T.

QuNet.greedyMultiPath! — Method

greedyMultiPath! is an entanglement routing strategy for multiple user-pairs in a quantum network.

  1. Each user pair has an associated Pathset that starts out empty. For each

userpair, the shortest path between them is found in terms of dF and the path is added to the pathset. If no path exists, nothing is added. This continues until one of the following criteria is met: + The pathsets are filled with the threshold number of paths (given by maxpaths)

  1. Entanglement purification is performed over all the pathsets, removing the

paths without adding purification channels.

  1. If a pathset is empty, no path was found between the end-user pair.

  2. When all the bundles are filled up to the maximum number "maxpaths", use an

entanglement purification method between the path costs. Add the resulting cost vector to the array purpaths. If no paths exist for a given bundle, increment the collision count by one, and add "nothing" to purpaths

  1. Return the array of purified cost vectors and the collision count.
source
QuNet.greedy_multi_path! — Function

greedymultipath! is an entanglement routing strategy for a quantum network with n end user pairs.

  1. Each user pair has an associated "bundle" of paths that starts out empty.

For each user pair, find the shortest path between them, and add its cost to the bundle. If no path exists, add "nothing" to the bundle.

  1. When all the bundles are filled up to the maximum number "maxpaths", use an

entanglement purification method between the path costs. Add the resulting cost vector to the array purpaths. If no paths exist for a given bundle, increment the collision count by one, and add "nothing" to purpaths

  1. Return the array of purified cost vectors and the collision count.
source
QuNet.handleRepeatPurification — Method

Checks to see if an identical purification has already been done before so the purification channel isn't duplicated

source
QuNet.heat_data — Method

Takes a network as input and returns greedymultipath! heatmap data for some number of user pairs. (i.e. a list of efficiency fidelity coordinates for all end users over all num_trials)

source
QuNet.make_user_pairs — Method

Generate a list of end-users for a TemporalGraph. srclayer and dstlayer specify the temporal locations of the source and dst nodes respectively. The default value for these is -1, which indicates the end-users should be asynchronus.

source
QuNet.make_user_pairs_wbuffer — Method

Generate a list of user_pairs for a square grid network, ensuring that there is an edge buffer of a given thickness.

QuNet.n_remAllChannels! — Function

Reduce the channel capacity associated with all channels connecting src and dst by one. If the channel capacity is zero, remove the channel.

source
QuNet.n_remChannel! — Method

Reduce the channel capacity associated with an channel by one. If the channel capacity is zero, remove the corresponding edge. If the channel is undirected, operate on both directions.

source
QuNet.n_remNode — Method

Remove a QNode from the graph and reindex the :nodeToVert map accordingly

source
QuNet.n_remShortestPath! — Method

Remove the shortest path in terms of the specified cost field. Returns the network path along with the associated costs.

source
QuNet.n_removeVertexPath! — Method

Given a literal path in the MetaGraph, remove it from the network, taking care that channel bandwidth is reduced where applicable and making sure not to remove edges not corresponding to channels.

source

QuNet.n_uniqueChannel — Method

Fetches the channel between srcNode and dstNode provided that one unique channel exists between them. If not, this function throws an error

source
QuNet.n_uniqueVertexPath — Method

Returns a list of tuples representing a vertex path in the network provided that each channel is unique. If not, this function throws an error.

Takes a network as input and return greedymultipath! performance statistics for some number of random user pairs. Ensure graph is refreshed before starting.

QuNet.relative_index — Method

Get the relative index of a node from its original index. ie. for a graph with nv = 10, steps = 3, then node 14 is the same relative to node 4. Another way to think about this is that it gets the index of the corresponding node in the top layer.

source

source
QuNet.remCostPrefix — Method

Strip prefix "CostΔ" from cost name

source
QuNet.remPathset! — Method

Remove the pathset from the graph.

If the frequency of a path in the pathset exceeds the capacity of the path, this function sets the frequency to this maximum capacity and removes that amount of paths instead.

source
QuNet.remove_async_nodes! — Method

Remove all asynchronus nodes of a TemporalGraph.

i.e. those put in place by addasyncnodes!

source
QuNet.reversePathset — Method

source
QuNet.setChanAttrs — Method

Set the attributes of a vertex corresponding to a qchannel. (Essentially all of the attributes of the qchannel except for the costs which go to the edges)

source
QuNet.setEdgeCosts — Method

Set the costs of a directed edge corresponding to a qchannel. (Because there are two of these in every channel, the costs are set to half their usual value)

source
QuNet.setVertexAttrs — Method

Set the attrtibutes of a vertex given a qnode and its index

source
QuNet.temp_to_async — Method

Convert temporal nodes into asynchronus nodes If the node is already asynchronus, it is returned Throws an exception if the node is out of bounds

source
QuNet.tuplesToEdges — Method

Convert a path of tuples to a path of edges

source
QuNet.unpackStruct — Method

Unpack the attributes of a struct into attributes of a MetaDiGraph object

Properties of a MetaGraph can be anything, including structs. Normally this wouldn't be an issue but setting the weights for methods like a_star with MetaGraphs.weightfield!() requires a single weight attribute to be set. This means that the fields of a struct like "Costs" need to be individually unpacked into the MetaGraph properties

The naming convention for unpacked attributes is identical to the 'dot notation' but replaced with right arrow (→).

Example: struct Foo bar end

Foo.bar => :FooΔbar

TODO: Make sure both channels are initialised.
